description: Single and two storey front to side extension, Conversion of garage to habitable room, Replacement of garage doors with window in front elevation, External alterations
decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-bottom: 0cm; line-height: normal;">The proposed two storey front to side extension due to its excessive width and overall bulk and lack of sufficient set back from the&nbsp; front and side elevation would fail to provide a proportionate, balanced, subordinate and harmonious addition to the host dwellinghouse, and would result in an overly dominant, obtrusive, and incongruous form of development that would erode the gap between the application site and No 134 Albury Drive, which would fail to respect the character and appearance of the host dwellinghouse, neighbouring properties and the prevailing pattern of development in the locality contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2024), Policy D3 (D(1) and (11)) of The London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 A, DM1 B (a), (b) and (c) of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).<span style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:
&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;mso-bidi-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;"><o:p></o:p></span></p>
